data.text: It always depends on if you have to be at the destination on a certain day, I had to be to my destination of a ride of 420 miles by 530 on the fourth day. It poured for a day and a half. Had to ride with water pouring out of my shoes. The ride was in cold temperature and you could see your breath and steam if my body. What did I learn from this is. Most of the water in my shoes was from water running down my legs. The second day I stopped at a store asked for a couple of small plastic shopping bags. I put new socks on bags over them and used shoelaces from my sneakers and tied around legs. Now feet dry in a wet shoe and no water in foot. I can't count how many porches, barns , hi way bridges I've just went to for cover. I now always carry two plastic bags. I use them for dry storage in my panniers. Also carry light rain ware.
